Articles.Content:
Wings(both stock and procedural) are not shielded if I put them inside a procedural fairing, procedural interstage fairing, KW rocketry fairing or B9 cargo bay. Other parts are shielded fine. I don't know if they could be shielded before because I've never put a wing inside a fairing in earlier versions. Could someone confirm this please?

Maybe there's a way to put IsShielded = True to needed parts and they will be automatically shielded?

Edited July 13, 2014 by Sparker
At last i can pull a pugachevs cobra in KSP!
Release 0.24 Ferram Aerospace Research, please!

Release 0.24 Ferram Aerospace Research, please!

The update has been released minutes ago, be patient

The update has been released minutes ago, be patient

Agreed. But for completeness sake, here's confirmation it isn't compatible without an update on FAR's end.
Literally clicked on this just in time to see it updated to 0.24 compatibility. Kudos, installing ASAP.
Thanks, adding this. Now all I need is KAC and KER
Be patient? I have 2 hours and 10 minutes before I can even get on a bus to get home to my KSP machine! Argh!
Yay for the instant update, you're the best ferram! And here I was worried that I'd get to experience the game without FAR once again, that would feel like going commando.
This is.. impressive! Although I'll wager you had early access But still, kudos!
Either that, or changes needed weren't all that big. Anyway, can't wait to try it out.

I'm glad the update came out so quickly, but I've encountered a problem while trying to play with the 64-bit version of KSP .24. When I try flying a plane I get a flood of NullReferenceExeptions the instant my velocity is anywhere above 0, and naturally my framerate suffers drastically. I removed all mods except for ModuleManager and FAR, and the problem persisted. Here's my KSP.log file for reference:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-WrBQvLtYTuQ3VFbUk1MUVSUDQ/edit?usp=sharing

KSP.log is useless. You must upload the output_log.txt instead, as that will actually have a stack trace to the source of the error.

I suspect that you are not actually running FAR v0.14, as constant nulls when velocity is above zero is a result of an older version of FAR.

Hah, what do you know. output_log.txt does indeed say I'm running 13.4. But I swear I downloaded the v14 folder from github multiple times. Or maybe I'm just going nuts here, let me double-check on this...

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-WrBQvLtYTuYjV0Y3JaMDRNY00/edit?usp=sharing

You must make the file public. I can't access it.

And the version naming being off is an error on my part, but I just tried it and I'm not seeing any null references in flight.
Oops, sorry. Just changed the access rights so the link ought to work now.

The first null is happening in the code that determines what parts are what.

Confirm that you have (working from the KSP root directory) a file at GameData/FerramAerospaceResearch/FARPartClassification.cfg. Then confirm that there are two blocks inside that file labelled "GreebleModule" and "GreebleTitle"
I just checked and I do see those modules in that file.
Just wondering something, ferram.. why the switch to the stock toolbar? And is it an intentional move to disable the FAR button in map view, or a game limitation? Just curious, is all.
There's an option to use the toolbar mod if you wanna.
I know that, yes - but to be honest, I kinda like it in the stock toolbar. Just wish it was available in map view too.
Well, then add that to the suggestions forum

@FenrirWolf: I have confirmed the issue; something is corrupted with the older example ships that FAR includes. It only occurs with them; all other vehicles are fine. I'll look into what's wrong with them.

@ObsessedWithKSP: I don't believe there's an option to use the stock toolbar in the map. In any case, I don't see why you'd open or close the FAR window there; you're either in space, in which case it's useless, or you're in the atmosphere on a long-haul flight, in which case, you probably already opened it.

So it's a game limitation then? Hmm.. seems an odd one. I don't have any other mods that use the stock toolbar (so far) so I didn't know if this was ferrams choice or if it was just how things had to be. That, and I don't know how to word it - "make mod buttons on the toolbar available in map view"?

EDIT: You make a good point, ferram. Guess I was just surprised to see it go, is all.

@FenrirWolf: I have confirmed the issue; something is corrupted with the older example ships that FAR includes. It only occurs with them; all other vehicles are fine. I'll look into what's wrong with them.

Sweet, I was just about to mention that I've only tried the stock FAR ships. Waiting on Interstellar to update before I try loading my old plane designs
